instructions.name: lh
lw
sh
instructions.definition:
assert((inm+rs1)%2==0; "The memory must be align")
MP.h.[inm+rs1]=rs2;

instructions.name: sw
instructions.definition:
assert((inm+rs1)%4==0; "The memory must be align")
MP.w.[inm+rs1]=rs2

instructions.name: srl
instructions.definition:
rd = rs1 >> rs2;
check_stack_limit(rd.name; sp.name; rd);

instructions.name: or
instructions.definition:
rd = rs1 | rs2;
check_stack_limit(rd.name; sp.name; rd);

instructions.name: and
instructions.definition:
rd = rs1 & rs2;
check_stack_limit(rd.name; sp.name; rd);

instructions.name: lwu
ld
flw
fsw
fsgnjx.s
instructions.definition:
let a = rs1<0; let b = rs2<0;
rd = a^b ? -Math.abs(rs1) : Math.abs(rs1);

instructions.name: fclass.s
instructions.definition:
let a = app.float2bin(rs1);
rd=checkTypeIEEE(parseInt(a[0]), parseInt(a.slice(1,9), 2), parseInt(a.slice(10), 2));

instructions.name: fld
fsgnjx.d
instructions.definition:
let a = rs1<0; let b = rs2<0;
rd = a^b ? -Math.abs(rs1) : Math.abs(rs1);

instructions.name: fclass.d
instructions.definition:
let a = app.float2bin(rs1);
rd=checkTypeIEEE(parseInt(a[0]), parseInt(a.slice(1,12), 2), parseInt(a.slice(13), 2));

instructions.name: syscall
